tournament.name: Players Tour Last Chance Qualifiers - JQualifier 2

decks.notes: This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Aether Gust while generating card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also utilizes powerful sweepers like Casualties of War and Extinction Event to deal with multiple threats at once. By generating value through powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and strong planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The main strategy of this Bant Control deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World in order to play big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The addition of cards like Aether Gust and Shatter the Sky help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death provide additional control elements. Overall, this deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and board control. The deck utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate extra mana and untap lands, allowing for multiple spells to be cast in a turn. The deck runs counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to card draw and a win condition in Shark Typhoon. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional value and card advantage, while Blaze Zone can handle problematic permanents. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win.

The primary strategy of this deck is to stall the opponent with counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana through cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The end goal is to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Shark Typhoon and Expansion/Explosion. The deck also utilizes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower for additional tempo and card advantage. By controlling the game and gradually out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to secure victory in the late game.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa along with counterspells and board clears to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Hydroid Krasis while utilizing cards like Tamiyo and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Shark Typhoon and Brazen Borrower provides additional versatility and answers to a variety of threats, making it difficult for opponents to gain an advantage and ultimately allowing the deck to grind out wins through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive green creatures with powerful abilities to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage. By utilizing cards like Barkhide Troll, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast, along with pump spells like Titanic Growth and Giant Growth, it aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Gemrazer and Stonecoil Serpent also provide additional versatility and utility in dealing with enemy threats. Overall, the deck aims to build a fast and resilient board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects, synergy with creatures dying, and stealing opponent's cards to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The goal is to control the board with small creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones, while also dealing direct damage with Mayhem Devil and Dreadhorde Butcher. By sacrificing creatures and utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent through aggressive plays and efficient resource management. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and consistency to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, utilizing counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute, while also ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon provide card advantage and a win condition, while Nightpack Ambusher and Brazen Borrower help to maintain board presence. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with efficient removal and versatile spells, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of card advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of discard spells, board wipes, and planeswalkers that disrupt their game plan. By using cards like Duress, Thought Erasure, and Narset, Parter of Veils to strip away the opponent's hand and draw power, while board wipes like Cry of the Carnarium and Elspeth Conquers Death keep the board clear. The planeswalkers, including Teferi, Time Raveler and Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God, provide additional disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to establish board control with powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, while also gaining card advantage through Teferi, Time Raveler's bounce ability. The deck's win condition revolves around creating a large board presence with creatures like Nightpack Ambusher and Hydroid Krasis, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with strong threats and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategies while generating card advantage and ramping up mana. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the tempo of the game and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate massive amounts of mana, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while maintaining control of the board. With a mix of removal spells, ramp cards, and powerful planeswalkers, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Jund Control deck is to generate value and control the board through sacrificing creatures, using cards like Mayhem Devil, Witch's Oven, and Cauldron Familiar. It aims to grind out the opponent by recurring creatures from the graveyard, while also utilizing cards like Trail of Crumbs and Bolas's Citadel for card advantage and additional threats. The deck also includes some disruptive elements with cards like Duress and Claim the Firstborn to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and incremental advantage to outlast and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize sacrifice mechanics and synergies to control the game by repeatedly sacrificing creatures for value and dealing damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Mayhem Devil and Cauldron Familiar to take advantage of sacrificing creatures, while also using cards like Trail of Crumbs and Priest of Forgotten Gods for card advantage and mana generation. The goal is to generate value through sacrifice effects and eventually overwhelm the opponent with incremental advantages while also controlling the board.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, bouncing their threats, and stalling the game with cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion. The deck utilizes a mixture of counterspells, creature removal, and card draw to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is optimized to ensure access to all three colors and to support the deck's control strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides extra card draw and life gain, while Shark Typhoon can create a large flying threat. The deck utilizes a mix of cards to handle various threats, including Aether Gust for red and green spells, Mystical Dispute for blue spells, and Brazen Borrower for tempo swings. Expansion / Explosion can serve as a finisher or draw engine.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, using removal and generating card advantage. It focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, to cast big threats like Uro and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards with Expansion/Explosion and creating tokens with Shark Typhoon. The mana base is optimized for casting spells of all colors efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and win through incremental advantage and card advantage.
